messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Not leaving..was Leroy
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Susan, I appreciate your input. Mimi
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Susan,

I appreciate your input.

Mimi


On Wednesday, November 28, 2001, at 06:52 AM, Joseph Fuerst wrote:

>>
>> Can some of you out there share with me how you incorporate your
>> participation in this group with your everyday life? I'm just
>> curious.
>> Maybe I can get a few tips.
>>
>> Mimi
>>
>>
> Mimi:I have made it part of my routine. I get up....get the day set up
> (ala
> Flybaby-steps)...and check my e-mail while my a.m. laundry load is in.
> If
> my afternoon routine allows for it, I get more time. I'm working on
> evening routine time... the computer time seems to wind me up then and I
> find it hard to get right to sleep ....or I tend to stay on too long!
>
> I also use the digest....it gives me a workable sized "chunk" to get
> through
> in about 15 minutes.
> However, when the list is really *hopping*, I find my replies are a
> bit
> 'outdated'. That is, others have responed with similar thoughts,
> which I
> may not see until the next digest. There are days/weeks when I have to
> delete whole digests without responding because ......well, because my
> family's needs are a higher priority.
> Best of Luck!
> Susan
>
>

messages.subject: Re: Not leaving..was Leroy
messages.msgSnippet: ... Mimi:I have made it part of my routine.  I get up....get the day set up (ala Flybaby-steps)...and check my e-mail while my a.m. laundry load is in.  If my
messages.messageBody:
>
> Can some of you out there share with me how you incorporate your
> participation in this group with your everyday life? I'm just curious.
> Maybe I can get a few tips.
>
> Mimi
>
>
Mimi:I have made it part of my routine. I get up....get the day set up (ala
Flybaby-steps)...and check my e-mail while my a.m. laundry load is in. If
my afternoon routine allows for it, I get more time. I'm working on
evening routine time... the computer time seems to wind me up then and I
find it hard to get right to sleep ....or I tend to stay on too long!

I also use the digest....it gives me a workable sized "chunk" to get through
in about 15 minutes.
However, when the list is really *hopping*, I find my replies are a bit
'outdated'. That is, others have responed with similar thoughts, which I
may not see until the next digest. There are days/weeks when I have to
delete whole digests without responding because ......well, because my
family's needs are a higher priority.
Best of Luck!
Susan
